We realize that there are some missing type issues in PySpec. To avoid inconsistency between pyspec and static language implementations, #1746 (https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/1746) is about making the Python typing more explicit and bounded with `remerkleable` SSZ internal checks around `uint`. (Thanks to <@!203220829473996800> and <@!600991921275535360> )

To avoid other ambiguity, I also created #1935 (https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/1935), which includes phase 0 `int_to_bytes` refactoring change.
